cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 185 (Wednesday, November 8, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. TORRES of California:H.R. 6319.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:According to Article 1: Section 8: Clause 18: of the UnitedStates Constitution, seen below, this bill falls within theConstitutional Authority of the United States Congress.Article 1: Section 8: Clause 18: To make all Laws whichshall be necessary and proper for carrying into Execution theforegoing Powers and all other Powers vested by thisConstitution inThe single subject of this legislation is:Office of Management and Budget to review and make certainrevisions to the Standard Occupational Classification System[Page H5653]

item.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 586.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Education and the Workforce. H. Rept. 118-692.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Education and the Workforce. H. Rept. 118-692.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 42 - 0.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held
Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

item.title: H.R. 6319, 911 SAVES Act of 2024
item.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Education and the Workforce on July 10, 2024

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

cdata.text:
Supporting Accurate Views of Emergency Services Act of 2023 or the 911 SAVES Act of 2023

This bill requires the Office of Management and Budget, by 30 days after the bill's enactment, to categorize public safety telecommunicators as a protective service occupation under the Standard Occupational Classification System.

item.titleType: Short Title(s) as Reported to House
item.title: 911 SAVES Act of 2024

item.titleType: Short Title(s) as Reported to House
item.title: Supporting Accurate Views of Emergency Services Act of 2024
Supporting Accurate Views of Emergency Services Act of 2023
To require the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to review and make certain revisions to the Standard Occupational Classification System, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 586.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
